page.title: 11CHANGING WITHERNSEA
page.content: Old inhabitants of the town are not convinced that the town has changed for the better.There are complaints about too many amusements and too much litter and dog dirt,especially on the Promenade.Chalets and a garlanded bandstand on the Prom have disappeared and 'diggers' or 'sandiggers' i.e. holidaymakers, are blamed for the dirty beach.There were once 3 cinemas but none survive.Other changes noted were the disappearance of a children's play area in favour of a compound for commercial fishing boats, and the filling in of the boating lake to create a crazy golf course. Despite an old people's home, new bungalows for the elderly and facilities at the community centre, there is a feeling that there is not a lot for old people to do with more done to cater for young people.
